meanings.definition: Resolute or steadfast in belief or opinion.
meanings.sent1: She was the firmest supporter of the team, always cheering them on.
meanings.sent2: He held the firmest belief in the power of kindness.
meanings.sent3: The firmest believer in magic, she wore a wizard hat everywhere.
meanings.sent4: Her heart was the firmest fortress, protecting her from any pain.
meanings.sent5: His determination was as firmest as a mountain, unwavering in the face of challenges.

meanings.sent1: The firmest friendship between them lasted a lifetime.
meanings.sent2: The rules of the game were the firmest traditions in their community.
meanings.sent3: The firmest grip on the trophy made him the champion.
meanings.sent4: Her love for him was the firmest foundation of their relationship.
meanings.sent5: The oak tree stood firmest against the strongest winds, rooted deeply in the ground.

meanings.sent1: The firmest rock in the garden never budged, no matter the storm.
meanings.sent2: His resolve was the firmest among all his peers.
meanings.sent3: The firmest tree in the forest danced in the breeze, unswayed by doubts.
meanings.sent4: Her trust in him was the firmest anchor in the turbulent sea of emotions.
meanings.sent5: The mountain stood firmest against time, unmoved by the passing years.
